topic: “He couldn’t stand up so I hit him over the head with my bass. He fell to the floor. I ran away… I didn’t know if he was still alive”: The bassist who survived Fairport Convention, Jethro Tull and believing he’d murdered his bandmate on stage

ideas.title: The Sticky Carpet Confession
ideas.premise: A shifty-eyed bassist confesses his onstage assault to a disinterested bartender at the Espy, amidst the usual sticky carpet grime.
ideas.why_funny: Relatable Melbourne venue; contrasts serious confession with mundane setting.

ideas.title: Moomba Parade Mishap
ideas.premise: The Fairport Convention bassist, dressed as a jester for the Moomba parade, accidentally whacks the king with his bass.
ideas.why_funny: Combining a dark act with an innocent Melbourne tradition.

ideas.title: The ACDC Bassist Audition
ideas.premise: A nervous bassist auditions for ACDC by demonstrating his 'Fairport Convention Technique' on a dummy during the Powerage era.
ideas.why_funny: Parodies AC/DC's intense energy and musical requirements.

ideas.title: Tram Troubles
ideas.premise: A bassist trying to escape after the incident is stuck on a crammed Route 96 tram, bass in hand, while the news report plays on someone's phone.
ideas.why_funny: Melbourne's iconic trams adding awkward pressure to the situation.

ideas.title: Flinders Street Frenzy
ideas.premise: The bassist runs through Flinders Street Station, pursued by a flock of seagulls mimicking the victim's final moments.
ideas.why_funny: Seagulls are a classic Melbourne pest; dark humour.
